meanings.definition: Having sworn falsely or broken an oath.
meanings.sent1: The foresworn knight was no longer trusted by the king.
meanings.sent2: The man's foresworn promise left a trail of broken hearts.
meanings.sent3: The foresworn student claimed the dog ate their homework, but no one believed them.
meanings.sent4: Her foresworn loyalty to the company cost her the promotion.
meanings.sent5: The foresworn pact between the two friends was shattered by betrayal.

meanings.definition: To have renounced or denied under oath.
meanings.sent1: She foresworn her allegiance to the old regime and joined the rebels.
meanings.sent2: The witness foresworn her previous statement under pressure from the defense.
meanings.sent3: The politician foresworn his promise to lower taxes, much to the dismay of the voters.
meanings.sent4: He foresworn his family's traditions and set out to explore the world.
meanings.sent5: The explorer foresworn the comforts of home for the thrill of the unknown.
